Description:
A Little Gem
Set on a corner allotment this 3 bedroom home is as pretty as a picture, bordered by a painted picket fence and established garden.The entrance leads through a central hallway to the living rooms with their cathedral ceiling creating a bright and spacious ambiance. The 3 bedrooms are of good size all with BIR's. The bathroom is neat as pin and the updated kitchen is pleasant and well appointed. Living areas are heated with a gas log fire and a reverse cycle air conditioner.

Description:
A supremely modern Victorian
$360,000 - $400,000
Central to the village and within walking distance to all amenities is this classic, heritage-listed Victorian residence that has been faithfully restored to its former glory with the most modern of improvements. Grand original chimneys tower over its symmetrical roofline and its bull nose verandah and portico, adorned with fretwork, frame the entrance between original casement windows.
The afternoon sun reflects along the length of the glistening floating floors of the arched hallway, off which are three, light- filled bedrooms. All have built in robes and the master, with its original cast iron gas log fireplace, looks out over the garden. A spacious Victorian-style bathroom replicates the era and is splendidly enhanced by an original brick fireplace.
At the end of the hall is the most seamless of extensions, retaining all the hallmarks of Victoriana yet with the most modern of layouts. The open plan living zone is under exposed beams and bordered by period dado paneling which runs the full width of the home.
The modern kitchen, with its bright, white cabinetry, reflects the mix of contemporary with period design. An island bench serves the formal dining room and extensive lounge with its wood log fire, all of which overlook the brick paved courtyard sunken into the lush green lawn of the garden. Adjacent to the kitchen is a large laundry with direct access to a deep double garage which has ample room for a workshop for the home handyman.
All this and more in year-round, climate-controlled comfort. It is a truly delightful restoration that retains the authenticity of yesteryear, yet ensures the astute buyer has the very best of modern comfort and convenience.
A quality restoration.
Land 520 sq m approx.
Terms 10% deposit, balance 30-90 days
Land: 520 sq m approx.

Description:
CHARMING VILLA NEAR TOWN'S CENTRE
Irresistible and only 200 metres from the centre of town - supermarket shopping, cafes and services. With its own identity and generous separation from neighbours this Villa has a homely feel and plenty of surrounding land to further develop according to your needs (perhaps a veggie plot). The spacious lounge room provides plenty of options for furniture placement. Having excellent public transport and highway to Geelong, Drysdale is proving popular with downsizers, retirees and first home buyers seeking excellent value and peaceful & friendly living. Three bedroom Villas this close to town's centre are certainly a rarity so quick to act.

Description:
Prime Position and Plenty of Potential.
$300,000 - $330,000
Rarely does such a sizeable allotment become available is this prized pocket of Drysdale, where space and serenity are valued above all. With access from two roads, this substantial parcel of land could be used for a variety of developments (STCA). The ideal site for a brand new home, the tantalising prospect of Bay views will have potential buyers salivating.
Mere minutes from shops and schools, yet retaining a tranquil pastoral air, this prime position is within close proximity of the Bellarine Peninsula's many wondrous attractions. Just 20 minutes from Geelong, 10 minutes from Ocean Grove and 5 from Portarlington, this rural haven offers easy access to coastal treats as well as city temptations.
With the Bellarine's fabulous beaches, vineyards and family activities at your door, the list of highlights is virtually endless. Do not miss this incredible opportunity!
Insights: 42 Whitcombes Road, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2010.

Description:
Enchanting Cottage In Garden Paradise
$380,000 - $420,000
Surrounded by delightful gardens on a substantial allotment, this charming two-storey stone cottage has a welcoming air that will enchant prospective buyers. At the top end of a tranquil court close to Drysdale shopping centre and schools, this beautiful home offers a lifestyle of country quiet with town comforts nearby.
Follow the garden path through a floral arch to the north-facing verandah, where a slate entry opens to a cosy sitting room. This leads to an enormous carpeted living area with air conditioner, wood heater and a glorious timber cathedral ceiling. A timber kitchen serves the spacious meals zone, and sliding doors open to a magnificent pergola-covered entertaining area overlooking the stunning rear gardens and lawn.
The downstairs main bedroom features a walk-in robe and semi-ensuite bathroom, while two upstairs bedrooms have built-in robes and ceiling fans and share a central bathroom and extra living area with a northern view to the hills. Downstairs, a study or home office can easily become a fourth bedroom.
Immaculately presented inside and out, this exceptional home is one of the Bellarine Peninsula's hidden treasures, and is sure to delight all who enter.
Insights: 5 Harold Court, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2013 and 35 other 4 bedroom house in Drysdale have recently been sold.

Description:
A Privileged Lifestyle
$380,000 - $420,000
The Brunswick wire fencing and brick-bordered cottage garden illustrate the quality and character of this period-style home. You approach the property along a wide and quiet country road and are immediately drawn to the front porch with its bull nosed verandah.
Pine wood floors lead to the master bedroom, complete with walk thru robes and own bathroom, and overlooking the front garden. A home office/study is located on the opposite side of the hallway. Further into the home, the earthen tones used throughout enrich the dining and family rooms adjacent to the vast colonial kitchen. The brick fireplace with its wide hearth enhances the country ambience of the home and central heating provides additional warmth for those chilly winter evenings.
The expansive and dado-walled formal lounge is perfect for entertaining guests, whilst the three remaining bedrooms beyond all have built in robes. There is a central bathroom with spa. Outside, a mature Claret Ash gracefully drapes the alfresco dining area of the large rear deck surrounding the home which is shaded by its bull nosed verandah during the balmy summer months. Looking northward from the porch the large gums in the near distance remind you of the area's farming past, yet you are within walking distance of all the nearby township has to offer.
A cobblestone driveway runs the full length of the home to the garage and serviced workshop at the rear. In addition, there is the lovely garden of lush green lawn and evergreen flora, raised brick vegetable and flower beds and the hens go about their daily chores in the pen at the back of the yard.
The Best of Country Living
Insights: 28 Elgin Street, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2009 and 35 other 4 bedroom house in Drysdale have recently been sold.

Description:
An inspired restoration
Once in a while a visionary makeover hits the mark and this is one to be admired. Centrally positioned amidst a drought tolerant garden with a myriad of pathways, a silver birch is all that remains of its past glory. Rendered in earthen texture and framed by contrasting and modern window furnishings you enter via the enclosed front porch.
The Baltic pine floors reflect the quality of this refurbished 3 bedroom, 1960s abode with an open central lounge and formal dining room taking in the afternoon sun. The quality kitchen, with stainless steel appliances, overlooks the raised timber alfresco dining deck. The front master bedroom has built-in robes, as does the middle bedroom, as well as a bright outlook and ceiling fan. Along the hallway you glimpse the lounge through contemporary cut-out recesses in the dividing wall opposite the central bathroom with its quality fittings.
The large rear yard with its secure fencing is safe and private and provides an ideal environment for children or animals. It sits within a landscape of evergreen flora, screening trees, ground covers and there is a garden shed for the handyman. This is a superb example of a quality renovation.
For the next generation.
Land 612 sq m approx.
Terms 10% deposit, balance 60 days

Description:
Take The High Road
$330,000 - $370,000
High above the historic township of Drysdale, with glimpses of the You Yangs across the Bay is this acreage of generous proportions. Sloping gently down toward the village from the road it is nestled among a variety of quality residences on similar blocks that have already taken advantage of this position.
All but the pinnacle of the Bellarine and within a minute's drive of all that Drysdale has to offer, it is surrounded by farms and vineyards for which the Peninsula is famous. Within easy access of the Surfcoast beaches, this remains one of the few opportunities to establish a blended lifestyle of country and coastal living just over an hour's drive from Melbourne and within 15 minutes of Geelong.
As one of the fastest growing villages on the Peninsula, time is of the essence to ensure you reserve your place in this quiet but significant location.
An incomparable lifestyle beckons.
Insights: 43-45 Buccleugh Street, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2009.

Description:
First Class Entertainers Home
$740,000 - $790,000
From its huge and imaginative 1 acre garden through to its exquisite hostess-style kitchen, this is a home tailor made for people who know quality, who love to entertain and who love an expensive lifestyle.
Wherever you look it is obvious the designer, the builder and the owners have pulled their skills, their resources and their imaginations to come up with a first class home that leaves nothing to compromise.
Inside, for example, there is that to-die-for kitchen where its top of the range features will fill your notebook with ticks of approval and in keeping with the modern trends; it is the focal point of the homes 4 spacious bedrooms, the formal lounge and dining rooms and the computer centre. Everything inside is just a few steps from the stunning weather protected courtyard, which is clearly linked to the rear of the huge 4-car garage.
The eye-catchers though are its hosts of features such as the cabana, massage, sauna and entertaining facilities (including a bar and comprehensive powder room with shower). All are perfect for family/guest parties or, alternatively, for those start the day morning coffees or quiet balmy evenings. The 4 bedrooms are of course ideal for extended families, visitors or stopovers while those who might want to add to their guest list should take a closer look at the barn. It is an impressive addition to the garden as it is, but inside you'll see where the owners, as with everything else, have taken that extra step - this time with a second floor to accommodate bedrooms.
Insights: 6-8 Filbay Crescent, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2012.

Description:
A Family Home in a Garden Most Splendid
$330,000 - $380,000
Nestled away in a quiet court, sunken below its shaded garden, is this as-new colonial style home. Entering under its arbor and onto the porch, the front door opens into a tiled entry foyer which in turn leads to the large lounge with its light and bright welcoming air. In addition to gas ducted heating, a gas log fire glows bright on those chilly winter nights and evaporative air-conditioning throughout addresses summer extremes. The home also has a 5 star energy rating.
A delightful bay window frames the master bedroom with its large ensuite and walk-in-robe. The additional two bedrooms have built-in-robes with the third also overlooking the pristine garden to the rear, taking in the morning sun. The central meals area, serviced by its large kitchen, also has a vista of the expansive English rose garden and dining beneath the large, shaded pergola would be a must on those balmy summer evenings.
Adjacent to the kitchen is an exceptionally large laundry and a private study/sewing room/fourth bedroom. The large single garage has ample storage and space exists alongside for a carport.
AGENT IN CONJUNCTION: Ian Reid Advocacy
Insights: 22 Marsh Court, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2009 and 22 other 3 bedroom house in Drysdale have recently been sold.

Description:
New Reduced Price - Great Opportunity
"Charm of Yesteryear with Modern Day Comforts"
Enjoy the charm of yesteryear and the convenience of modern day comforts in this delightful 3-year old Federation-style reproduction. Superbly presented and finished with only the finest in fixtures and fittings, this 3-bedroom family home boasts an array of character features including stunning timber polished floors, leadlight windows, high ceilings with decorative roses, ornate cornices and wide skirting boards.
Fall in love with the home's warm and inviting ambience, cook up a storm in the modern country style kitchen with its quality stainless steel appliances and relax and entertain in the open plan living areas featuring a gas log fire and split-system air-conditioner. These spacious living areas open out through appealing French doors to a timber deck, ideal for alfresco dining. The master bedroom offers a walk-in robe and ensuite, along with a delightful box bay window overlooking the front verandah.
Extra features include a separate study with soaring timber-lined turret tower, luxurious bathroom with spa bath, lovely rear garden setting with vegetables beds, copses of silver birch, off-street parking for 2 cars and a garden shed.
Situated in a pretty tree-lined street in semi-rural surrounds, the home offers privacy and tranquillity yet also has the convenience of schools, shops and public transport only minutes away.
Insights: 42 Crimea Street, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2009 and 22 other 3 bedroom house in Drysdale have recently been sold.

Description:
A Spectacular Home On 20 Glorious Acres
$2 million - $2.2 million
This is a majestic property, and certainly amongst one of the most impressive on the Bellarine Peninsula.
Set on 20 acres of rolling hills with sweeping views back across Swan Bay to Port Phillip Bay and the Heads, this is a two-storey rendered villa of exceptional grandeur. Recently totally renovated, it offers the very latest in equipment, appointments and comforts. Both levels are totally heated and air-conditioned, all carpets and floors are in top condition and all fittings and fixtures are of the very best quality.
Downstairs the open space living area is gigantic, comprising colonial-style kitchen with laboradorite benchtops, butler's pantry, dining and living areas. Beyond is expansive timber decking overlooking the view south-east to the sea.
Also on this floor is a billiard room, four very luxurious bedrooms with BIRs, two elegant bathrooms, and a store room.
Upstairs is a second extensive living room, also with outside deck overlooking the sea. This level houses the master bedroom which has its own dramatic sea view, its sumptuous ensuite and a custom-designed and fitted dressing room.
On this first level there is also another guest bedroom, adjacent bathroom, an office with built-in cabinets and a sewing room. That makes a total of six bedrooms and four bathrooms.
Outside there's a double garage, two very large machinery sheds with mezzanine levels, a lock-up store room, lock-up wine room, and an orchard.
The property has working sheep and cattle yards and is particularly suitable for keeping horses. It shares a border with Scotchmans Hill winery and is in the middle of the Drysdale wine and olive country.
Overall this is a graceful and arresting property in every possible respect, offering a rural-coastal lifestyle of immense elegance.
* Sweeping ocean views
* 20 acres
* Totally renovated double-storey mansion
* 6 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms
Insights: 176 Scotchmans Road, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2008.

Description:
Wine and Olive Country Near the Sea
$695,000 - $760,000
Nestling in a secluded valley just outside Drysdale is this beautiful property, just under 3 acres, and with an 18-year-old brick veneer house of great charm.
This is in the middle of the wine and olive country of The Bellarine. There's a horse stud next door, Drysdale is a 10-minute walk, and there's even a glimpse of Port Phillip Bay and Geelong.
The very spacious house has three bedrooms, study, two bathrooms, formal dining room, formal lounge, and an immense open plan area comprising kitchen, dining and living rooms. There's also a large rumpus room which along with the second and third bedrooms form a separate guest area with its own luxury bathroom and laundry.
The main bedroom has bay window, quality carpets, spacious ensuite and WIR. Next to it is a comfortable study, then the handsome formal dining room and separate formal lounge with electric space heater.
Perhaps the heart of this enchanting house is the open space kitchen/dining/living rooms which is beautifully appointed with quality fittings and has a wonderful country atmosphere. It has a wood burner heater with flue, reverse inverter a/c unit, overhead fan, and modern kitchen cooking equipment as well as a fully-functioning vintage combustion stove.
The house is surrounded by superb rolling lawn gardens, with a front covered veranda and extremely generous paved barbecue area at the back.
Other features include a trellised green house, 4-car garage, excellent separate concrete floor workshop and a productive orchard offering apples, plums, peaches, citrus, olives, nectarines, figs, quince, berries, passion fruit.
Spread through the gardens are many types of eucalypt, and various other native trees.
The present owner of 10 years likes the peace, "and being able to live on our own fruit most of the year". This is a magnificent country estate near the sea.
* Peaceful rural setting
* Abundant producing orchard
* Elegant and spacious house
* Wonderful condition
Insights: 42-50 Hutchinson Court, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2014 and 22 other 3 bedroom house in Drysdale have recently been sold.

Description:
Rural Bliss and Superb Bay Views on 5 Acres
$570,000 - $630,000
Set in idyllic rural surrounds with enchanting bay views, this charming yet contemporary 2-storey residence will steal your heart away. Boasting spectacular rural views from every window as well as a breathtaking vista across Corio Bay and beyond, this property on 5 acres is pure magic.
As you make your way up a long circular tree-lined drive, you feel a wave of serenity wash over you. While very private and secluded, the property also offers the convenience of amenities only minutes away.
Finished in a light rendered brick, the immaculately presented property provides spacious open plan living making it perfect for weekend getaway or permanent family residence. Stand-out features include 2 large living areas with impressive polished timber floors, enclosed outdoor entertaining area complete with roll down cafe blinds and a superb upstairs parent's retreat, which opens out to extensive timber decking showcasing panoramic views across the bay. Imagine family get-togethers and celebrations in this picturesque setting where the bay and wise old gums are your only neighbours.
Indoor entertaining will be just as impressive in either of 2 large areas: one with a Coonara wood fire, the other with full length windows overlooking those magic rural and bay views.
Kitchen facilities include a gas cooktop, under bench Chef oven and double sink. Meals can be enjoyed in the adjoining dining area or outside on one of the many timber lined decks.
Downstairs also features 2 bedrooms - both with built-in robes, study, laundry and bathroom.
The property also offers its own dam, several water tanks, cedar cubby house, under- cover wood storage area, double garage and shedding.
Insights: 35 Martins Road, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2008 and 22 other 3 bedroom house in Drysdale have recently been sold.

Description:
Stylish Family Home
$290,000 - $319,000
Stylish and practical, this attractive brick home provides for a perfect family life. Offering 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, the home is cleverly designed and neatly presented. Set in a quiet street, yet close to shops and schools, the delightful property is both comfortable and convenient. Lovely established gardens present a warm welcome to the home, which opens to a slate-tiled entry. Step inside to find a spacious, open plan family, dining and kitchen area with soaring timber-lined ceilings and impressive leadlight windows. The timber kitchen provides a dishwasher, electric stove, timber benchtops and plenty of cupboard space. Temperature control is made easy thanks to a gas heater and a reverse-cycle air-conditioner. The master bedroom includes an ensuite, while all the bedrooms have ceiling fans and built-in robes. Outdoor entertaining can be enjoyed on a brick paved, undercover patio area, set among pretty gardens. There's also an established vegetable patch for those who like organic produce. A double car-port, remote garage door and low-maintenance gardens with a water tank complete this pretty picture.
Insights: 4 Bennett Street, Drysdale VIC 3222 was last sold in 2008 and 22 other 3 bedroom house in Drysdale have recently been sold.

Description:
Immaculate 4 Bedroom Homestead in Idyllic Setting
$640,000 - $700,000
This magnificent 17060 sqm approx. property is ideally set in one of the Bellarine Peninsula's most coveted locations, just moments away from wineries, restaurants and beaches. With a leisurely country ambience and an elevated outlook to the tranquil pastoral surroundings, your dream lifestyle begins right here. The Federation-style 4 bedroom timber homestead boasts a sensational return verandah to take in the sweeping views, and 3 separate living areas. Enter the immaculately maintained home to find a host of attractive features including lustrous polished Baltic Pine floorboards, high ceilings and decorative arches. A formal lounge room has an open fireplace and a bay window with a serene rural aspect. There's a brilliant kitchen serving the spacious dining room and large living room, both with doors to a fantastic rear deck and BBQ area. The living room also boasts a wood heater and air conditioner to maintain the comfort levels all year round. The master bedroom features a walk-through robe to an ensuite, and French doors to the superb verandah. With a large permaculture garden, orchard, 6-car garage with bathroom, and much, much more, this exceptional property will set your imagination racing.

Description:
Beautiful Renovation Offers Comfort and Convenience
$250,000 plus
This recently renovated and beautifully presented 3 bedroom brick veneer home is set on a generous corner block in the heart of Drysdale, just moments from the town centre's shops and cafes. With delightful pathways through the bordering native gardens and a northern entertaining deck, it offers a relaxed lifestyle with added convenience. Bright and tidy throughout, the home features an entrance hall with glowing polished timber floorboards and a wide archway to the carpeted living room with gas heater, adjoining meals area and big modern kitchen with stainless steel appliances and sliding doors to the sunny deck. The 3 well proportioned bedrooms share an updated tiled bathroom with separate toilet, and a large tiled laundry opens out to the northern rear yard. A single carport completes this lovely property, and with the adjacent vacant allotment also for sale, this is an opportunity you won't want to miss.

Description:
Centrally Located, Modern Design, Rural Ambience
$500,000 plus
"BELLARINE PENINSULA" The home - a first class two year old 2 storey brick veneer home with light-filled interior. The home features approximately 32 squares of living space including 4 double bedrooms (main with walk-in robe and ensuite with spa bath), huge upstairs studio, 3 generous living areas (including formal dining and sitting room), expansive well-appointed entertainer's kitchen with wonderful adjoining meals area, walk-in pantry. The generous double lock up garage has internal access. With 2 bathrooms, evaporative cooling, ducted heating and a covered outdoor pergola/entertaining area overlooking the formal, beautifully planned gardens, this is simply a marvellous home in a very special setting. The property - situated on a large allotment (2075 sq metres approx), the home is nestled in amongst a planned, formal and informal garden setting. A wonderful path system allows access to enchanting "special places" and these, with clever use of grey water, allows for relatively easy maintenance, privacy and pride. In summary - a fine home with generous proportions in an established and magnificent garden setting, close to all major facilities."

Description:
"Brilliant Transformation of a Noted Property".
$450,000 plus
"Drysdale House"

In the heart of the Bellarine Peninsula, this corner site features an historic 1890s home with a modern, double-storey, superbly-appointed addition. A former feature of the Australian House Museum, this renovated and restored home offers a very flexible floorplan,and has many potential uses. With 5/6 bedrooms, 3 quality bathrooms, double lock-up garage, loads of off-street parking, ducted heating and evaporative cooling, this is your chance to set up a
charming home in a central location surrounded by established gardens. Alternatively, the home is large enough for an up market B & B, or could also be used as professional rooms or an art gallery - the choices are many and varied (STCA). The original home has been fastidiously restored and renovated and the recent double storey addition enhances and amplifies the home's many attributes. Unique investment potential or comfortable residence.
Close to wineries, restaurants, , beaches, shops, school(s), public transport, lake and charming Queenscliff-Drysdale tourist railway service and Geelong.
* Restored and renovated * 5/6 bed rooms
* Historic home * Bellarine Peninsula
